title: Sodium Stearyl Fumarate
overview: Sodium stearyl fumarate (SSF) is a fine, white powder. Odorless powder derived from stearyl alcohol and fumaric acid. This excipient functions primarily as a highly effective lubricant and glidant within pharmaceutical formulations, particularly in the tableting process. They are used to enhance the flowability of a powder by reducing the interparticle friction, surface charge, and cohesion.
features: Possesses superior lubricating properties, reducing friction between tablet ingredients and manufacturing equipment
Prevents sticking and picking issues during tableting, improving tablet appearance and production efficiency
SSF dissolves readily, potentially improving dissolution profiles compared to traditional water-insoluble lubricants
Enhances powder flowability for consistent filling of tablet dies
Promotes smooth tablet ejection from the press
Demonstrates good compatibility with a wide range of active ingredients
Typically used in smaller concentrations compared to some other lubricants

applications.title: Pharmaceutical
applications.description: Widely used as a lubricant in tablet and capsule formulations, particularly where traditional lubricants may be incompatible or less effective

applications.title: Nutraceutical
applications.description: Potential applications in supplement formulations where enhanced lubrication and flow properties are desired (check compatibility)
